review.title: Noisy water waster
review.reviewText: The room was tiny, but the bathroom was large. It was not too clean, the floor hadn't been swept, the sheets and one scrawny blanket were too small for the bed. The air conditioning only worked fitfully. The staff stood outside our room and talked and smoked, so we couldn't open the window. We could hear everything in the room above us. When we returned to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, the bed was made, but the bedspread was jammed on top of the TV cabinet, the staff did not clean out the coffee pot, nor replenish the coffee, cups and stirrer packets. We only got two chintzy towels. The worst thing was that you had to run the water for at least 5 minutes before it got hot. What a waste, especially during a drought! The tub floor was sticky and had hair stuck to it. The " continental breakfast" was packaged pastries and toast. The TV reception was spotty. All together an unpleasant experience, especially for the price!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was close to the beach and right across the street from the SF Zoo.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff need to be better trained in basic social skills. The clerk never said a word to us during check in. Better Cleaning service is needed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the beach and to the zoo. Also, easy access to the rest of San Francisco.

review.title: Shady and expensive
review.reviewText: This hotel was loud and not very clean. The breakfast consisted of toast. There was no elevator so definitely don't bring a suitcase. When the staff came to clean the room during our stay, they also made sure to unplug everything including the fridge.

review.title: no amenities and a little outdated
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because I couldn't stand to pay $300+ to be downtown or by the wharf.  However, after staying here I wonder if it would have been worth the money to stay at the more expensive hotel.  
There is no lobby, no space to move around, no pool, no elevator etc.  We spent 7 days in california on a roadtrip and although this hotel was the most expensive of all of our nights, it had the worst accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: update the bedding and enlarge the lobby and breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: Its by the zoo, and about 4 blocks from the beach, but we didn't have time in our agenda to do either of those things.

review.title: Tired hotel but clean.
review.reviewText: Rooms very cramped and tired looking. Functional rather than anything else.

review.title: SFSU
review.reviewText: Over priced for what you get. Very basic. Not special. The breakfast is toast and coffee. Rooms are clean and decent size. If I don't need to be close to SFSU, I will not stay here

review.title: Stayed at to go to the zoo
review.reviewText: Checked in and lady who helped us was courteous but not very friendly. We stayed two nights and overall place was dirty and loud. The carpet had a wet spot and a couple of sticky spots on the and by spots I mean areas not small spots. The shower was basic but clean the bed was not very comfortable and the curtains did not eve keep the light out there was a street lamp right outside the our window that basically was shining in the room because the curtains did not seal at all on the sides. The lamps in the room were unplugged when we got there so we could not see as we entered. Did have a fridge which was nice but almost the only nice feature except being really close to the zoo. Don't think I would stay here again at any price.
I was pleasantly surprised by the accommodations at Days Inn. The room was clean and tidy.

review.title: Walking distance to zoo, beach and L line.
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to zoo, beach and L line. Not much dining within walking distance. Continental breakfast is pretty terrible but there is a cafe right next door that opens at 6 am and serves good food.
Expedia price does not include tax.

review.title: Convenient location to SFSU
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located to SFSU and allowed easy accessibility to search for a home close to the campus for my daughter, who is attending the school in the Fall.
review.positiveRemarks: The parking was free and on the property.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is a bit dated, but clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The zoo was right across the street and the beach was a few blocks away.

review.reviewText: Not suited for business travelers, no lobby or amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, good views from front of hotel, staff somewhat friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a lot of maintenance: wallpaper peeling, carpets cleaned, breakfast area in hallway difficult to access.

review.title: Excellent location, close to the ocean
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Stairs and hallways were shabby. Breakfast facilities extremely poor. No elevator but good parking. Close to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast area and selection of items.

review.title: Days in - not too bad
review.reviewText: Love the location - Watch the sun set on the ocean just 3 short blocks from hotel.  Just acrose the street from the zoo.  A nice surprice - the Irish clutural center around the corner is an a lovely restaurant with a lively talented irish bank on Saturday nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very helpful, room a nice size.  parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Radio was bad and noisey and new one was worse.
review.locationRemarks: Great coffee place next door - sandwiches and salads too.

review.title: two stars at the four star price
review.reviewText: The title says it all over price and under delivered. I have nothing more to write but it is making me do it for the review.. But hey it's in the city so life good.  Liquor store next door so I could get drunk and dream of staying at a nicer place

It was over priced for what the room looked like.  
The parking was extremely close to fit a car unless you have a compact car
The continenal breakfast was very disappointing.

review.title: Nightmare in Pacifica
review.reviewText: Music blaring until 1am. manager no help in stopping the problem

review.title: Good hotel close to the beach and zoo
review.reviewText: The hotel was decent and comfortable.  It was a good night sleep and the price was incredible for San Francisco.  The breakfast was meager and lacked choices.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: My title says it all. Steps to surfing OB and a good pizzeria next door.

review.title: Great place for the cost!
review.reviewText: This hotel is easy to find at the end of Sloat Avenue.  Very close to Ocean Beach and a very short drive to the wonderful Cliff House Restaurant.  Free parking!  This is a basic hotel with  free breakfast of apples, oranges, juices, coffee, English Muffin or pastry.
review.positiveRemarks: Check in is at 2:00.  Free parking is good but close for my full size vehicle.  The room was clean and I did not hear street noise in my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Some furnishings are ready to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: This place is right near the ZOO and just blocks from the ocean.

review.reviewText: Front desk attendant was super friendly when checking me in. The room was clean, but felt a little bit dirty because of dinginess. Bed was decent and there was free wifi.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location. Free parking. Large bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Room is dated and could definitely use some paint.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the beach. Close to the zoo.

review.reviewText: Staff friendly and helpful, If not familiar with public transportation it is hard to get around. Taxi very expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: fix walls under windows. Windows were filthy. Gigantic hairball in bathroom. Better breakfasts.
review.locationRemarks: Close to zoo. Very far from other attractions.
